dimensions:
plate (sight): 33 cm (13 in.)
sheet (sight): 35.4 x 32.7 cm. (13 15/16 x 12 7/8 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: Collector's stamp: Karl Eduard von Liphart (Lugt 1687)
inscribed:
Two Latin distichs in margin around oval: SCIRE, DEI MVNVS, DIVINVM EST NOSCERE VELLE, SED FAS LIMITIBVS SE TENVISSE SVIS. DAM SIBI QVISQ SAPIT, NEC IVSTI EXAMINA CERNIT, ICAVS ICARYS NOMINA DONAT AQVIS.

Initialed in plate, lower center: C.C. Inue. / HG, Sculp. / 2
catalograisonne: Bartsch 79.259; Hollstein 307 I; New Hollstein 326; Strauss 258

makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
after Cornelis Cornelisz. van Haarlem, 1562–1638; born and died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Karl Eduard von Liphart [1808-1891, Lugt 1687]; sale of his collection, Leipzig, December 5, 1876, lot 933. Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
